comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.created_time: October 22, 2022, 03:13:14 PMLast edit: October 22, 2022, 04:13:58 PM by Little Mouse
comments.body: Do all these accounts belong to the same person? My god, how can they maintain all these even? And the return? I don't think it's any more profitable like a guy said a few months back, he was able to make a million from his bounty-hunting alt farm.I will go through all these accounts and check if they are currently abusing bounty managed by me. Seems I will have bunches of them. Have to spend an hour to tag them all.Quote from: Pandu Geddon on October 22, 2022, 03:35:31 PMfrom the few I saw from the account above, they are in your most recent bounty campaign. I hope it won't be exhausting to tidy up your spreadsheets¬† Yeah, I just checked and found few of them are enrolling in the campaign.

comments.author: Pandu Geddon
comments.body: cannot be trusted if the accounts are managed by one person. no wonder there are mistakes made by the owners of these accounts in doing POA or bounty reports.if you see how this cheater works, I'm sure after this account is marked. there will be dozens of new accounts that he will manage for another cheating bounty campaign.Quote from: Little Mouse on October 22, 2022, 03:13:14 PMI will go through all these accounts and check if they are currently abusing bounty managed by me. Seems I will have bunches of them. Have to spend an hour to tag them all.from the few I saw from the account above, they are in your most recent bounty campaign. I hope it won't be exhausting to tidy up your spreadsheets

comments.author: yahoo62278
comments.created_time: October 22, 2022, 05:22:44 PMLast edit: October 22, 2022, 09:13:52 PM by yahoo62278
comments.body: Ok, so good job on catching all these newbies I suppose but now what? You just tagged 67 newbie accounts and it will stop nothing. That just means that this user will now create 67 other newbie accounts and continue the cycle. I am not getting on you @lovesmayfamilis, i'm just saying this stops nothing. Bounty managers are going to have to implement a rule of no newbies to start making a difference. Once jr member and above accounts get tagged it might slow them down. It also might not, but IMO tagging newbies doesn't do much. @Bounty managers!!! You need to stop allowing newbies to join period! Also, no neg trusted accounts allowed. Yea your numbers will go down, but at least you are trying to make a difference. As are you lovemayfamilis, i'm not saying you're doing anything wrong here at all. I'm just saying it's a waste for any of us to chase newbie farms. If managers fall in line and use the no newbie rule, newbies become a little more irrelevant.Quote from: dkbit98 on October 22, 2022, 07:06:49 PMQuote from: lovesmayfamilis on October 22, 2022, 02:24:32 PM+67 Accounts Connected Accounts Connected: (Note: Banned shown in red / Inactive in Blue)Very good research on finding this farm cheaters @lovesmayfamilis.I just don't have the nerve myself to dig and investigate things like this anymore.Agreed, very good job on the research and finding all these cheaters. Really not trying to make you feel like what you have done here is irrelevant. I'm on a rant about these cheaters and how can we combat them. Keep finding these morons and tagging them until we can devise a way to stop them.

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: lovesmayfamilis on October 22, 2022, 02:24:32 PM+67 Accounts Connected Accounts Connected: (Note: Banned shown in red / Inactive in Blue)Very good research on finding this farm cheaters @lovesmayfamilis.I just don't have the nerve myself to dig and investigate things like this anymore.Quote from: yahoo62278 on October 22, 2022, 05:22:44 PMOk, so good job on catching all these newbies I suppose but now what? You just tagged 67 newbie accounts and it will stop nothing. That just means that this user will now create 67 other newbie accounts and continue the cycle. It will at least slow this farmers down, and eventually it could stop some of them.They will have to spend more time creating new accounts and starting everything from zero.But I agree with you that this is just part of work for cleaning the forum, other part should be on bounty managers, maybe we should implement some kind of rating for managers.

comments.author: KingsDen
comments.body: Sometimes in this forum, I'll see some strange usernames which appear to be meaningless looking at it, but due to this is a multilingual forum, I'll assume such usernames make meaning in different languages. Usernames like; kwibeen, khagwwm, ghoset, mikeq, norkeeb, slamewn etc I am just realising that some of these usernames are random alphabets on the keyboard, chosen by account farmers when creating large number of accounts. Even if this type of catch won't stop subsequent account farming, it will surely slow down their efforts. They might even be discouraged from creating more accounts because there is every possibility that they would be caught again when they haven't earned some rewards. Creating another farm will mean creating new social media accounts, new emails and new btt accounts. This will be tedious for anyone to do twice a year

comments.author: Pokapoka124
comments.body: This is a big bust. Kudos to lovemayfamilis for bringing down this huge alt farm. It‚Äôs incredible that one person would be able to manage 67 accounts on the forum, all participating in bounties. They probably have an office where they go to everyday to do their ‚Äújob‚Äù. I think bounty managers should adopt the same merit rules they use for signature campaigns for bounty application, I doubt if any of the busted account has up to 20 merits in 120 days.

comments.author: YOSHIE
comments.body: @lovesmayfamilis, I saw this topic and thought it was a team/group Alt, it seems I was wrong in that, of course I tried to check for a moment, for sure it's not a group, Alt is controlled by the same person.I see from my development, some of them use the same Address and engage in cheating in the same campaign, for that I also see that there are several other Alts behind all of this.For example evidence as below1. cedoodeeQuote from: mesnakirik on April 25, 2021, 03:31:29 PMTelegram Username: @ThanthuongbountyBinance Smart Chain Wallet address: 0xE5D4ed28a4D9Feb123C62794364F536cba27Aa7A[ Archive ]Quote from: cedoodee on July 06, 2021, 07:23:35 PMBSC Wallet Address: 0xE5D4ed28a4D9Feb123C62794364F536cba27Aa7A[ Archive ]1. rilifi5173Quote from: tranglebounty on May 08, 2021, 12:58:11 AMProof of authentication- ETH:¬† 0xf3a49BB8e3B5091b853655b2d28A6Eb3D8D10b9C[ Archive ]Quote from: rilifi5173 on April 25, 2021, 05:25:24 PMBinance Smart Chain Wallet address: 0xf3a49BB8e3B5091b853655b2d28A6Eb3D8D10b9C[ Archive ]I'm sure, there are many more Alts if you explore more.

comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: Quote from: YOSHIE on October 23, 2022, 06:42:36 PMI'm sure, there are many more Alts if you explore more.I have seen a few same patterns from the above people and I'm sure that they have at least 10 more alt accounts that are abusing the TenUp bounty campaign. I don't have the time to look up at this moment but I will surely come back with the investigation if I find any concrete proof although I know this doesn't mean anything but kicking them out from the bounty campaign because they will create another bunch of accounts and continue farming.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: Quote from: Little Mouse on October 25, 2022, 03:39:06 AMQuote from: YOSHIE on October 23, 2022, 06:42:36 PMI'm sure, there are many more Alts if you explore more.I have seen a few same patterns from the above people and I'm sure that they have at least 10 more alt accounts that are abusing the TenUp bounty campaign. I don't have the time to look up at this moment but I will surely come back with the investigation if I find any concrete proof although I know this doesn't mean anything but kicking them out from the bounty campaign because they will create another bunch of accounts and continue farming.Take it higher. A few more accounts, which I tagged after I posted this accusation, are visible in my feedback. The same action pattern. Old social networks are used in other accounts. And YOSHIE is right; there are many more, and even more than 10, as you can imagine. If you check them by registrations with telegram contacts, it will be seen that many are not active. I just marked the accounts that are active today. And to be honest, I was looking at your company. I did not find in the rules a ban on the participation of alternative accounts, so I did not mention your bounty in the lists of those where cheaters cheated. Thanks for tagging everyone.

comments.author: JollyGood
comments.body: Many thanks for this and well done for your efforts. As soon as I have ample time I will start looking in to the accounts and then will start tagging the appropriate ones.Quote from: lovesmayfamilis on October 22, 2022, 02:24:32 PM+67 Accounts Connected Accounts Connected: (Note: Banned shown in red / Inactive in Blue)~snip~
